p: 2) In the discussion, the authors discuss the importance of NSAID doses in multiple locations (line 329, line 320, line 377). The comparison of doses across species is a slippery slope. Dosing comparisons from rodents to humans, or calves to humans, is complex, particularly when dealing with drugs whose pharmacokinetics are not known in the particular host species. If the authors wish to make an argument for their dose over prior published literature, some discussion on known pharmacokinetics, allometric scaling and its possible implications in this study should be added.
